sheet.p: Used in item listings and search results.

Click on Analysis Categories (against shaded backgroundto see Analysis Services in each category. Enter minimum and maximum values to indicate a valid results range. Any result outside this range will raise an alert. The % Error field allows for an % uncertainty to be considered when evaluating results against minimum and maximum values. A result out of range but still in range if the % error is taken into consideration, will raise a less severe alert. If the result is below ' Max'

The profile's keyword is used to uniquely identify it in import files. It has to be unique, and it may not be the same as any Calculation Interim field ID.

When it's set, the system uses the analysis profile's price to quote and the system's VAT is overridden by the analysis profile's specific VAT

page.p: Used in item listings and search results.
Used in item listings and search results.
Enter a comment that describes the changes you made.

Define interim fields such as vessel mass, dilution factors should your calculation require them. The field title specified here will be used as column headers and field descriptors where the interim fields are displayed. If 'Apply wide' is enabled the field ill be shown in a selection box on the top of the worksheet, allowing to apply a specific value to all the corresponding fields on the sheet.

The formula you type here will be dynamically calculated when an analysis using this calculation is displayed. To enter a Calculation, use standard maths operators, + - * / ( ), and all keywords available, both from other Analysis Services and the Interim Fields specified here, as variables. Enclose them in square brackets [ ]. E.g, the calculation for Total Hardness, the total of Calcium (ppm) and Magnesium (ppm) ions in water, is entered as [Ca] + [Mg], where Ca and MG are the keywords for those two Analysis Services.
Enter a comment that describes the changes you made.

sheet.p: Used in item listings and search results.

To be displayed below each Analysis Category section on results reports.
The laboratory department
Used in item listings and search results.
Select a manager from the available personnel configured under the 'lab contacts' setup item. Departmental managers are referenced on analysis results reports containing analyses by their department.

page.p: If text is entered here, it is used instead of the title when the service is listed in column headings. HTML formatting is allowed.
The service's commercial ID for accounting purposes
The service's analytical protocol ID
Used in item listings and search results.
If enabled, the name of the analysis will be written in italics.
The measurement units for this analysis service' results, e.g. mg/l, ppm, dB, mV, etc.

The unique keyword used to identify the analysis service in import files of bulk AR requests and results imports from instruments. It is also used to identify dependent analysis services in user defined results calculations
The results of field analyses are captured during sampling at the sample point, e.g. the temperature of a water sample in the river where it is sampled. Lab analyses are done in the laboratory
The category the analysis service belongs to
The price charged per analysis for clients who qualify for bulk discounts
Enter percentage value eg. 14.0
The laboratory department
Enter a comment that describes the changes you made.
Define the number of decimals to be used for this result.
Define the precision when converting values to exponent notation. The default is 7.

The Lower Detection Limit is the lowest value to which the measured parameter can be measured using the specified testing methodology. Results entered which are less than this value will be reported as < LDL

The Upper Detection Limit is the highest value to which the measured parameter can be measured using the specified testing methodology. Results entered which are greater than this value will be reported as > UDL

If checked, a selection list will be displayed next to the analysis' result field in results entry views. By using this selector, the analyst will be able to set the value as a Detection Limit (LDL or UDL) instead of a regular result
Indicates whether file attachments, e.g. microscope images, are required for this analysis and whether file upload function will be available for it on data capturing screens

group.p: Maximum time allowed for completion of the analysis.A late analysis alert is raised when this period elapses

page.p: If enabled, this analysis and its results will not be displayed by default in reports. This setting can be overrided in Analysis Profile and/or Analysis Request
Enter a comment that describes the changes you made.
When checked display the text as limit in Certificate Of Analysis (COA) otherwise display the Min Max range values on COA.
When checked no text displayed in "Status" column of Certificate Of Analysis (COA).
Select if the results for this Analysis Service can be set manually.

The Analysis Service can be performed by using more than one Method. The methods selected here are displayed in the Analysis Request creation view for its selection when this Analaysis Service is selected. Only methods with 'Allow manual entry of results' enabled are displayed.
Select if the results for this Analysis Service can be set using an Instrument.
If 'Allow instrument entry of results' is selected, the method from the default instrument will be used. Otherwise, only the methods selected above will be displayed.
Select if the calculation to be used is the calculation set by default in the default method. If unselected, the calculation can be selected manually
Values can be entered here which will override the defaults specified in the Calculation Interim Fields.
When the results of duplicate analyses on worksheets, carried out on the same sample, differ with more than this percentage, an alert is raised
Check this box if the analysis service is included in the laboratory's schedule of accredited analyses
Enter a comment that describes the changes you made.

Specify the uncertainty value for a given range, e.g. for results in a range with minimum of 0 and maximum of 10, where the uncertainty value is 0.5 - a result of 6.67 will be reported as 6.67 +- 0.5. You can also specify the uncertainty value as a percentage of the result value, by adding a '%' to the value entered in the 'Uncertainty Value' column, e.g. for results in a range with minimum of 10.01 and a maximum of 100, where the uncertainty value is 2% - a result of 100 will be reported as 100 +- 2. Please ensure successive ranges are continuous, e.g. 0.00 - 10.00 is followed by 10.01 - 20.00, 20.01 - 30 .00 etc.

Precision as the number of significant digits according to the uncertainty. The decimal position will be given by the first number different from zero in the uncertainty, at that position the system will round up the uncertainty and results. For example, with a result of 5.243 and an uncertainty of 0.22, the system will display correctly as 5.2+-0.2. If no uncertainty range is set for the result, the system will use the fixed precision set.
Allow the analyst to manually replace the default uncertainty value.
Enter a comment that describes the changes you made.
Please list all options for the analysis result if you want to restrict it to specific options only, e.g.'Positive', 'Negative' and 'Indeterminable'. The option's result value must be a number
Enter a comment that describes the changes you made.
Check this box to ensure a separate sample container is used for this analysis service
Select a default preservation for this analysis service. If the preservation depends on the sample type combination, specify a preservation per sample type in the table below

Select the default container to be used for this analysis service. If the container to be used depends on the sample type and preservation combination, specify the container in the sample type table below
Please specify preservations that differ from the analysis service's default preservation per sample type here.

The minimum sample volume required for analysis eg. '10 ml' or '1 kg'.
The default container type. New sample partitions are automatically assigned a container of this type, unless it has been specified in more details per analysis service
